article: Many years ago three soldiers, hungry and tired of battles, came upon a small village. The villagers, _ a poor harvest and many years of war, quickly _ what little they had to eat and met the three at the village square, wringing their clothes and complaining of the _ shortages. The soldiers spoke quietly among themselves and the first soldier then turned to the village elders. "Your tired fields have left you _ to share, so we will share what little we have: the _ of how to make soup from stones." _ the villagers were interested and soon a fire was put to the town's greatest pot as the soldiers dropped three smooth _ into the pot full of water. "Now this will be a fine soup," said the second soldier, "but a little salt and some parsley would make it _ !" Up jumped a villager, crying "I've just remembered _ some have been left!" She ran away, _ with the parsley and salt. _ the water boiled, corn, carrots, beef and cream _ their way into the pot when all sat _ to have a large meal. The villagers ate and sang and danced well into the _ , full of energy again by the meal and their new-found friends. In the next morning the three soldiers _ up to find the whole village standing before them. At their feet _ a bag of the village's best bread and cheese. An elder said that the soldiers had given them the _ gift: the secret of how to make soup from stones and they would never forget. The third soldier turned to the _ and said, "There is no secret, but this is certain: it is only by _ that we may enjoy a large meal."
